fi.grimripper.loww.movement

Interface MovementModifier


  • public interface MovementModifier
    Anything that implements this interface can affect various aspects of movement. It can change the movement cost of a tile, and make impassable terrain passable or vice versa. It can also affect obstacles, movement events and blocks, as well as perform other things during the generation of a movement radius.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen
    See Also:
    MovementMode

    • Method Detail

      • getMovementHeight

        Height getMovementHeight(Tile atTile,
                       Height height,
                       boolean occupy)
        Gets movement or occupy height at a certain tile. Movement height is usually based on terrain and obstacles, but modifiers can increase it. Movement modifiers aren't allowed to decrease movement height.
        Parameters:
        atTile - get movement height at this tile
        height - movement height without effect from this modifier
        occupy - true for occupy height, false for movement height
        Returns:
        movement height with effect from this modifier

      • modifyTerrainCost

        float modifyTerrainCost(Terrain terrain,
                      float moveCost)
        Modifies movement cost for terrain. The moveCost parameter can also be very large to indicate impassability, and this should be taken into consideration. This method is executed only once per terrain type. When modifiers are added or removed, the cost is calculated again.
        Parameters:
        terrain - terrain whose cost is modified
        moveCost - the movement cost before changes from this modifier
        Returns:
        the movement cost after changes from this modifier

      • modifyObstacleCost

        float modifyObstacleCost(Tile tile,
                       Obstacle[] obstacles,
                       float moveCost)
        Modifies movement cost for obstacles. The moveCost parameter can also be very large to indicate impassability, and this should be taken into consideration. This method is executed once for every tile checked during movement radius generation. Parameter obstacles don't include ones that were ignored because of movement height or movement modifiers.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile whose cost is modified
        obstacles - obstacles that were considered for movement cost
        moveCost - movement cost with terrain and the given obstacles
        Returns:
        movement cost after changes from this modifier

      • modifyBlockCost

        float modifyBlockCost(Tile to,
                    Tile from,
                    MobileObject mobile,
                    Height height,
                    Block[] blocks,
                    float moveCost)
        Modifies movement cost for blocks. The moveCost parameter can also be very large to indicate impassability, and this should be taken into consideration. This method is executed every time the move radius search enters a new tile, since it depends on direction. Parameter blocks don't include ones that were ignored because of movement height or movement modifiers.
        Parameters:
        to - the tile whose cost is modified
        from - the tile where the mobile object moves from
        mobile - the moving mobile object
        height - the mobile object's movement height at the to tile
        blocks - blocks that were considered for the move cost
        moveCost - movement cost with terrain, obstacles and blocks
        Returns:
        movement cost after changes from this modifier

      • modifyHeightChangeCost

        float modifyHeightChangeCost(Tile tile,
                           float cost,
                           Height height,
                           Height newHeight)
        Modifies the cost of changing movement height for movement modes that allow it. This is used only if movement height can be changed by the movement mode itself. The result is the cost of changing from one height level to another.
        Parameters:
        tile - tile where the mobile object is
        cost - height change cost without this modifier
        height - current height
        newHeight - height after change
        Returns:
        height change cost with this modifier

      • allowsOccupation

        boolean allowsOccupation(MobileObject occupier,
                       Tile occupyTile)
        Can enable a mobile object to occupy a tile it normally couldn't. This test is separate from the move cost change, which doesn't affect occupation. This method isn't called for a tile that can be occupied anyway. It isn't called in cases where a movement modifier may not allow occupation: the mobile object's template can't be partially outside the tile grid, and the mobile object may not occupy an already occupied tile.
        Parameters:
        occupier - the mobile object
        occupyTile - check if the modifier allows occupation of this hex
        Returns:
        true if this modifier allows occupation

      • ignoresObstacle

        boolean ignoresObstacle(Obstacle obstacle)
        Checks if this modifier allows ignoring an obstacle. The obstacle will not affect movement height or movement cost.
        Parameters:
        obstacle - an obstacle
        Returns:
        true if the obstacle should be ignored

      • ignoresBlock

        boolean ignoresBlock(Block block,
                   Tile from,
                   Tile to,
                   Height height)
        Checks if this modifier allows ignoring a block. The block will not affect movement cost, and can't prevent the mobile object from moving onto it.
        Parameters:
        block - a block
        from - the mobile object is leaving this tile
        to - the mobile object is entering this tile
        height - the mobile object is moving at this height
        Returns:
        true if the block should be ignored

      • getProtectionAgainstEvent

        int getProtectionAgainstEvent(MovementEvent event,
                            Tile tile)
        Checks if this modifier protects the host against a movement event.
        Parameters:
        event - event which might have adverse effects
        tile - tile where the event is located
        Returns:
        negative if the host is affected normally by the movement event, zero if the host's movement can't be interrupted by the event, or positive if host is immune to the event's effects, and the event doesn't even get executed
